info.title: Mailjet API
info.description: A complete collection of all publicly available endpoints and methods for the Mailjet API

Messages.Subject: My first Mailjet Email!
Messages.HTMLPart:
Dear passenger 1, welcome to Mailjet!


May the delivery force be with you!

get.summary: Retrieve Messages Sent to a Specific Email Address
Retrieve Aggregated Statistics for an API Key

post.description: Send a message via Send API v3. Send API v3 is built mainly for speed, allowing you to send up to 100 messages in a single API call, as opposed to v3.1, where the limit is 50 messages per call. However, it lacks some of the more complex functionalities of Send API v3.1 like detailed feedback information in case of sending errors.

Messages.Subject: Your email flight plan!
Messages.Text-part: Dear passenger, welcome to Mailjet! May the delivery force be with you!
Messages.Html-part:
Dear passenger, welcome to Mailjet!


May the delivery force be with you!

get.summary: Retrieve Sending / Size / Spam Info about All Messages
get.description: Retrieve sending / size / spam information about all messages.

get.summary: Retrieve Sending / Size / Spam Info about a Single Message
get.description: Retrieve sending / size / spam information about a specific message ID.
Retrieve a list of all contacts. Includes information about contact status and creation / activity timestamps.

post.description: Add a new unique contact to your global contact list and select its exclusion status.

get.description: Retrieve a specific contact. Includes information about contact status and creation / activity timestamps.

put.description: Update the user-given name and exclusion status of a specific contact.

get.summary: Retrieve All Lists a Contact is Part of
get.description: Retrieve all contact lists for a specific contact. You will receive information on the status of the contact for each list. Information about lists deleted within the last 60 days will be returned as well, since those are soft-deleted and can be reinstated.

post.summary: Manage the Lists a Contact is Part of
post.description: Manage the presence and subscription status of a contact for multiple contact lists. Select the contact lists, as well as the desired action to be performed on each one - add, remove or unsub. The contact should already be present in the global contact list.

post.summary: Manage the Lists for Multiple Contacts
post.description:
Manage multiple contacts by adding, removing or unsubscribing them from multiple contact lists. Separate actions are set for each list and implemented for all contacts listed.

Once you submit the POST request, it will return a JobID, which you can use to verify the success of the POST request, as well as see what kind of errors came up.

get.summary: Retrieve an Upload Request for Multiple Contacts
get.description: Use the JobID generated after a POST /contact/managemanycontacts request to check its success, as well as any errors that might have occurred.
Retrieve a list of contact properties and their general settings - name and data type.

post.description: Create a new contact property. Select its name and data type, then use it to assign property values for contacts of your choice (with /contactdata).

get.summary: Retrieve a Single Contact Property Object
get.description: Retrieve information on a specific contact property - its name and data type.

put.description: Update the settings of an existing contact property - name and data type. Changing the data type will not affect existing property values, but new values must be entered using the new data type.

delete.description: Delete an existing contact property. Once the property is deleted, the values assigned to it for all contacts are also deleted.

get.description: Retrieve a list of contacts with all properties and respective values associated with those contacts.

post.summary: Create Property Values for a Contact
post.description: Create the extra static data for a contact by using your already created /contactmetadata objects (contact properties) and assigning / updating values to them for the specific ContactID.

get.summary: Retrieve the Property Values for a Contact
get.description: Retrieve all properties and respective values associated with a specific contact.

put.summary: Update Property Values for a Contact
put.description: Update the extra static data for a contact by using your already created /contactmetadata objects (contact properties) and assigning / updating values to them for the specific ContactID.

delete.summary: Delete Property Values for a Contact
delete.description: Delete all contact property values relating to a specific contact.

get.description: Retrieve details for all contact lists - name, subscriber count, creation timestamp, deletion status.

post.description: Create a new contact list.

get.description: Retrieve details for a specific contact list - name, subscriber count, creation timestamp, deletion status.

put.description: Update a specific contact list by changing its name and / or deletion status. Using PUT you can delete lists, as well as reinstate previously deleted ones.

delete.description: Delete a contact list. The ContactsList object will continue to exist with Deleted status for 30 days, and can be reinstated by changing the value of IsDeleted to false via PUT /contactslist/{list_ID}.

post.summary: Import a Contact List into Another List
post.description: Add, unsubscribe or remove the contacts present in a list to / from another list. The list ID specified in the body of the payload is the source, while ID in the path specifies the destination list.

get.summary: View the Import Status of a List into Another List
get.description: Use the JobID generated after a POST /contactslist/{list_id}/importlist request to check its progress, success, as well as any errors that might have occurred.

post.summary: Manage a Contact's Subscription to a List
post.description: Manage the presence and subscription status of a contact to a specific contact list. The API will internally create the new contact if it does not exist, as well as add or update the name and properties.

post.summary: Manage the Sub Status of Multiple Contacts to a List
post.description: Manage multiple contacts by adding, removing or unsubscribing them from a specific contact list. Once you submit the POST request, it will return a JobID, which you can use to verify the success of the POST request, as well as see what kind of errors came up.

get.summary: View the Import Status of Multiple Contacts into a List
get.description: Use the JobID generated after a POST /contactslist/{list_id}/managemanycontacts request to check its progress, success, as well as any errors that might have occurred.

post.description: Add, remove or unsubscribe a list of contacts to/from a specific contact list by using a CSV uploaded to the Mailjet Data server. The CSV needs to be uploaded via the /contactslist/{list_id}/CSVData/text:plain endpoint.

get.summary: View the Status of a CSV Import
get.description: View the settings and status of a contact CSV import job. The CSV needs to be uploaded via the /contactslist/{list_id}/CSVData/text:plain endpoint - only then can you create an import job.

put.summary: Update a CSV Import in Progress
put.description: Update or abort a contact CSV import job in progress.

get.summary: Retrieve All Subscription Requests via a Sub Widget
get.description: Retrieve details about all contact list signup requests via a subscription widget. Provides details on signup and subscription confirmation IPs, timestamp, subscription source etc.

get.summary: Retrieve a Single Subscription Requests via a Sub Widget
get.description: Retrieve details about a specific subscription request done via a subscription widget. Provides details on signup and subscription confirmation IP, timestamp, subscription source etc.
Retrieve details on all list recipients, including the contact and list associated with them, as well as subscription status.

post.description: Create a new list recipient. A list recipient object manages the relationship between a contact and a contactslist - every instance of a contact being added to a list creates a new list recipient. Both the contact and the list need to be created beforehand.

get.description: Retrieve details for a specific list recipient, including the contact and list associated with it, as well as the subscription status.

put.description: Update the subscription status of a list recipient.

delete.description: Delete a list recipient. This effectively removes a contact from a contact list.

get.description:
Retrieve details about a list of sent campaigns - creation and sending time, sender, subject, tracking options enabled etc. Each e-mail going through Mailjet is attached to a Campaign. This object is automatically generated by Mailjet.

Note: If no query parameters are used, only campaigns sent since 00:00 UTC on the current day will be returned.

Retrieve details about a specific campaign - creation and sending time, sender, subject, tracking options enabled etc. Each e-mail going through Mailjet is attached to a Campaign. This object is automatically generated by Mailjet.

put.description: Manage the deletion and "starred" status of a campaign. Each e-mail going through Mailjet is attached to a Campaign. This object is automatically generated by Mailjet.

get.description: Retrieve details on the configuration of all campaign drafts. Newsletter and CampaignDraft objects are differentiated by the EditMode values. We recommend using CampaignDraft, as Newsletter objects are ones created using the legacy Mailjet template builder.

post.description: Create a new campaign draft. Newsletter and CampaignDraft objects are differentiated by the EditMode values - we recommend using CampaignDraft, as Newsletter objects are ones created using the legacy Mailjet template builder.

get.description: Retrieve details on the configuration of a specific campaign draft. Newsletter and CampaignDraft objects are differentiated by the EditMode values - we recommend using CampaignDraft, as Newsletter objects are ones created using the legacy Mailjet template builder.

put.description: Update the configuration settings of a specific campaign draft. Newsletter and CampaignDraft objects are differentiated by the EditMode values - we recommend using CampaignDraft, as Newsletter objects are ones created using the legacy Mailjet template builder.

get.summary: Retrieve the Contents of a Campaign Draft
get.description: Retrieve the content of your campaign draft email. It will be split between a Text part, HTML part, MJML content and/or additional headers.

post.summary: Create the Contents of a Campaign Draft
post.description:
Create, update or delete the content of your campaign draft email. You can select a Text part, HTML part, MJML content, as well as additional headers.

Each POST request overwrites any content previously added - e.g. if you have submitted HTML content on the initial POST, and on the next you only submit Text content, the previously saved value of Html-part will be deleted.

example.Html-part:
Dear passenger 1, welcome to Mailjet!


May the delivery force be with you!
example.Text-part: Dear passenger, welcome to Mailjet! May the delivery force be with you!

post.summary: Schedule the Sending of a Campaign Draft
post.description: Schedule the sending of a campaign draft.

get.summary: Get the Sending Schedule of a Campaign Draft
get.description: Retrieve the sending schedule of a campaign draft.

put.summary: Update the Sending Schedule of a Campaign Draft
put.description: Update the sending schedule of a campaign draft.

delete.summary: Cancel the Scheduled Sending of a Campaign Draft
delete.description: Cancel the scheduled sending of a campaign draft.

post.summary: Send a Test Email of a Campaign Draft
post.description: Test a created campaign draft by sending it to a selection of recipients. The status of the campaign draft will not be affected by the test.
Send a campaign draft immediately.

get.summary: View the Sending Status of a Campaign Draft
get.description: View the sending status of a campaign draft.

get.summary: Retrieve Overviews of All Campaigns and Drafts
get.description: Retrieve delivery and engagement statistics for all drafts, AB Testing objects or sent campaigns. In addition, for each object you will see its type, edit tool used and creation time, as well as general info like the title and subject line for the campaign.

get.summary: Retrieve an Overview of a Campaign or Draft
get.description: Retrieve information about a specific draft, AB Testing object or sent campaign. You will see its type, edit tool used and creation time, as well as general info like the title and subject line for the campaign.

Retrieve a list of all segments and details on their configuration. Segments can be applied on contact lists when you send your campaigns. Segmentation is done based on additional data saved for contacts via /contactmetadata and/or based on contact activity (or lack thereof).

post.description: Create a new segmentation formula to be applied on contact lists when you send your campaigns. Segmentation can be done based on additional data saved for contacts via /contactmetadata and/or based on contact activity (or lack thereof).

example.Description: Users that have not clicked on an email link in the last 7 days, and are under 30 years old
example.Name: Inactive customers 30 or under

get.description: Retrieve configuration details for a specific segment. Segments can be applied on contact lists when you send your campaigns. Segmentation is done based on additional data saved for contacts via /contactmetadata and/or based on contact activity (or lack thereof).

put.description:
Update an existing segment. Segments can be applied on contact lists when you send your campaigns. Segmentation is done based on additional data saved for contacts via /contactmetadata and/or based on contact activity (or lack thereof).

Only segments with deleted status can be updated via the API. Deleted segments can be updated to unused.

example.Description: Users that have not clicked on an email link in the last 7 days, and are over 30 years old
example.Name: Inactive customers 30 or over

delete.description:
Delete an existing segment. Segments can be applied on contact lists when you send your campaigns. Segmentation is done based on additional data saved for contacts via /contactmetadata and/or based on contact activity (or lack thereof).

The deletion is a soft one and a deleted segment can later be reinstated by changing its Status via a PUT request.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all templates and their configuration settings.

post.description: Create a new email template object and select its basic configuration settings.

get.description: Retrieve the configuration settings for a specific template.

put.description: Update the configuration settings of an email template.

get.summary: Retrieve the Contents of a Template
get.description: Retrieve the contents of an email template. It will be split between a Text part, HTML part, MJML content and/or additional headers.

post.summary: Create the Contents of a Template
post.description: Create the contents of an email template. You can select a Text part, HTML part, MJML content, as well as additional headers.

put.summary: Update the Contents of a Template
put.description: Update the contents of an email template - the Text part, HTML part, MJML content and/or the additional headers.

get.summary: Retrieve Aggregates Stats Grouped by Contact
get.description: Retrieve a list of overall aggregated delivery and engagement statistics, grouped by contact.

get.summary: Retrieve Aggregates Stats for a Single Contact
get.description: Retrieve a list of overall aggregated delivery and engagement statistics for a specific contact.

get.summary: Retrieve Stats Grouped by List Recipient
get.description: Retrieve a list of overall aggregated delivery and engagement statistics for all list recipients. A list recipient object manages the relationship between a `contact` and a `contactslist` - every instance of a contact being added to a list creates a new list recipient.

get.summary: Retrieve Stats for a Single List Recipient
get.description: Retrieve a list of overall aggregated delivery and engagement statistics for a specific list recipient.

get.summary: Retrieve Stats Grouped by Recipient Country
get.description: Retrieve aggregated open and click statistics, grouped by recipient country.

get.summary: Retrieve Stats for all Clicked Links in a Campaign
get.description:
Retrieve aggregated click statistics for a campaign, grouped by URL links. Links will be identified by their URL and position index within the campaign template.

Note: This is a new endpoint. Only available for accounts created after April 5th, 2018.

parameters.name: CampaignID
parameters.description: Mandatory: Retrieves statistics only for the specified campaign ID.

get.summary: Retrieve Stats for all Clicked Links
get.description:
Retrieve a list of overall aggregated click statistics, grouped by URL.

Note: If no query parameters are used, will return stats with FromTS equal to the current day at 00:00 UTC.

get.summary: Retrieve Recipient Domain Stats for a Campaign
get.description:
Get aggregated delivery and engagement statistics, grouped by recipient Email Service Provider (ESP).

Note: This is a new endpoint. Only available for accounts created after April 5th, 2018.

parameters.name: CampaignID
parameters.description: Retrieves statistics only for the specified campaign ID.

get.summary: Retrieve Open/Click Stats Grouped by Web Browser
get.description:
Retrieve a list of open or click statistics, grouped by web browser or email client.

Note: If no query parameters are used, will return stats with FromTS equal to the current day at 00:00 UTC.

get.summary: Retrieve an Event Summary for a Message
Retrieve Evolution of Stats for a Campaign

parameters.name: IDS
parameters.description: Mandatory: Retrieves only statistics for the specified campaign IDs. Multiple IDs can be separated with a comma.

get.summary: Retrieve Total Stats for an API Key
Retrieve Stats Grouped by Recipient Domain
Retrieve Evolution of Stats by Time Intervals

parameters.name: Scale
parameters.description:
Scale of the time intervals for the statistics:

- `Hour`
- `Day`
- `Week`
- `Month`
- `Year`

get.summary: Retrieve Stats Grouped by Contact List
Retrieve Stats for a Single Contact List
Retrieve Stats for a Single Sender

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all bounce events and details about them - message, contact and campaign IDs, timestamp etc.

Note: If no query parameters are used, will return events with FromTS equal to the current day at 00:00 UTC.
Retrieve information about a specific bounce event.

Retrieve a list of all click events and details about them - message and contact IDs, timestamp, URL and click delay.

Note: If no query parameters are used, will return events with FromTS equal to the current day at 00:00 UTC.

Retrieve a list of all open events and details about them - message, campaign and contact IDs, timestamp etc.

If no query parameters are used, will return events with FromTS equal to the current day at 00:00 UTC.
Retrieve open event details for a specific message.

Retrieve a list of all callback URL objects and their configuration settings. Whenever an action (e.g. email open) occurs, the information about it will be sent to the selected callback URL. You can then set up different automation workflows triggered by the tracked actions.

Note: The URL provided cannot be a root URL.

post.description:
Add a new callback URL used as a webhook to track different email actions. Whenever an action (e.g. email open) occurs, the information about it will be sent to this callback URL. You can then set up different automation workflows triggered by the tracked actions.

Note: The URL provided cannot be a root URL.

get.description:
Retrieve the configuration settings of a specific callback URL. Whenever an action (e.g. email open) occurs, the information about it will be sent to the selected callback URL. You can then set up different automation workflows triggered by the tracked actions.

Note: The URL provided cannot be a root URL.

put.description: Update the configuration settings of an existing callback URL - which type of events it tracks, the URL used, whether it is active or not etc.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all parseroute instances and their configuration settings.

post.description:
Create a new parseroute instance. Provide the webhook URL you want to use. The Mailjet Parse API will then createa parse email adedress in the response. Alternatively, you can select a parse email yourself. Emails received to this address will be parsed and the information sent to the webhook URL you have provided in a JSON format.

Note: The URL provided cannot be a root URL.

get.description: Get the configuration details for a specific parseroute resource.

put.description: Update the settings of an existing parseroute instance - the webhook URL and/or email address.

get.description:
Get information on a list of sender email addresses and/or domains. The e-mail address or domain has to be registered and validated before being used to send e-mails. Validation is done via /sender/{sender_id}/validate. In order to manage a sender available across multiple API Keys, see the related /metasender resource.

Note: The maximum number of senders and metasenders per user is 100. This includes both validated (Active) and non-validated (Inactive) ones, but does not include Deleted senders / metasenders.

post.description:
Create a new sender email address or domain. The e-mail address or domain has to be registered and validated before being used to send e-mails. Validation is done via /sender/{sender_id}/validate. In order to manage a sender available across multiple API Keys, see the related /metasender resource.

Note: The maximum number of senders and metasenders per user is 100. This includes both validated (Active) and non-validated (Inactive) ones, but does not include Deleted senders / metasenders.

get.description: Retrieve details on a specific sender email address or domain.

put.description: Update an existing sender email address or domain.

delete.description: Delete an existing sender email address or domain.

post.description: Validate a registered sender email address or domain. A sender domain (*@domain.com) is validated by checking the caller's rights, the existence of a metasender for that domain or by searching for the ownership token on the domain root or in the DNS.

get.description:
Retrieve a list of all metasenders and their configuration settings. A metasender is a sender available for use by the Master API Key and all sub-accounts. The e-mail address or domain has to be registered and validated before being used to send e-mails. Validation is done by contacting the Mailjet Support team. In order to manage a sender available for a single API Key, see the related /sender resource.

Note: The maximum number of senders and metasenders per user is 100. This includes both validated (Active) and non-validated (Inactive) ones, but does not include Deleted senders / metasenders.

post.description:
Create a new metasender email address or domain. A metasender is a sender available for use by the Master API Key and all sub-accounts. The e-mail address or domain has to be registered and validated before being used to send e-mails. Validation is done by contacting the Mailjet Support team. In order to manage a sender available for a single API Key, see the related /sender resource.

Note: The maximum number of senders and metasenders per user is 100. This includes both validated (Active) and non-validated (Inactive) ones, but does not include Deleted senders / metasenders.

get.description: Retrieve an existing metasender object and its configuration settings.

put.description: Update and existing metasender email address or domain. Only the email address and description can be updated.

get.summary: Retrieve SPF / DKIM Settings of All Sender Domains
get.description: Retrieve the SPF and DKIM settings for all sender domains on this API Key. The information will help you configure your SPF and DKIM settings on the respective domain, before running a DNS check with /dns/{dns_id}/check to validate it and complete the SPF and DKIM authentication.

get.summary: Retrieve SPF / DKIM Settings of a Sender Domain
get.description: Retrieve the SPF and DKIM settings for a specific sender domain on this API Key. The information will help you configure your SPF and DKIM settings on the respective domain, before running a DNS check with /dns/{dns_id}/check to validate it.

post.summary: Do a DNS Validation of a Sender Domain
post.description: Perform a DNS validation of a sender domain. The Mailjet API will check for a TXT record in the domain's DNS zone file.

get.description: Retrieve a list of all API Keys and their configuration settings. API Keys are used as credentials to access the API and SMTP server.

post.summary: Create a New Subaccount API Key
post.description: Create a sub-account with a new Public and Secret API Key. API Keys are used as credentials to access the API and SMTP server.

get.description: Retrieve the configuration settings of a specific API Key. API Keys are used as credentials to access the API and SMTP server.

put.description: Update the settings of an existing API Key. You can use this to deactivate an API Key as well. API Keys are used as credentials to access the API and SMTP server.

get.description: Manage your user profile data such as address, payment information etc.

put.description: Update your profile information - personal and organization settings.

get.description: Get general information on your user settings and activity.

put.description: Update the settings of your User ID - username, registered email, language and time zone settings.

get.summary: Retrieve the Contents of a Newsletter

post.summary: Create the Contents of a Newsletter

put.summary: Update the Contents of a Newsletter

delete.summary: Delete the Contents of a Newsletter

post.summary: Schedule the Sending of a Newsletter

get.summary: View the Sending Schedule of a Newsletter

delete.summary: Cancel the Scheduled Sending of a Newsletter

put.summary: Update the Scheduled Sending of a Newsletter

get.summary: View the Sending Status of a Newsletter

post.summary: Send a Test Email of a Newsletter

get.description: Get SMS

Https Basics.description: For all Email API endpoints, requests are authenticated using HTTPS Basic Auth. It requires you to provide a username and a password for each API request. The username is your API Key and the password is your API Secret Key - you can find them in your API Key Management page. Both keys are generated automatically when your account is created.

tags.name: Getting Started Examples
tags.description: The requests in this folder will help you easily follow the examples in the [Getting Started section](https://dev.mailjet.com/guides/#getting-started) of the Mailjet API Guide.

tags.name: Send Email
tags.description:
Send API v3 and v3.1 are part of Mailjet's transactional messaging suite. Send API v3.1 gives more detailed feedback information on your sendings, while Send API v3 gives you a higher sending limit per single API call.

For information on sending email campaigns to a list of contacts, please see the [Campaigns](https://dev.mailjet.com/guides/#send-marketing-campaigns) section.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: Every time you send an email via Mailjet, a new message object is created. The resources below help you retrieve details about these messages - sending time, delivery and contact engagement info, recipients, message size, etc.

tags.name: Contacts
tags.description: Contact, Contact Lists and List Recipients are objects that help you organize the contacts you want to send emails to. The resources below help with the management of contacts and additional contact properties (metadata), as well as providing information on the subscriptions done through Mailjet subscription widgets.

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: To send a marketing campaign to a contact list of your choice, you first need to create a campaign draft object. In it you specify the email content, recipients, sender email, etc. Once it's sent out, a new campaign object is created. The resources below will help you manage those objects and retrieve information about them.

tags.name: Segmentation
tags.description:
Segmentation is an extremely useful tool used to target a specific group of customers with a dedicated campaign. Create segments based on contact properties or the contact activity (opens, clicks). Segmentation helps you focus your campaigns on specific demographics, create re-engagement campaigns, etc.

The resources below help you manage your segmentation formulas.

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: Templates are essential building blocks for your campaigns, transactional emails or automation workflows. With the resources below you can manage your templates and their content.

tags.name: Statistics
tags.description:
The statistics resources provide a read-only access to your Mailjet statistics. The different endpoints will help you extract metrics groups based on different factors, such as campaigns, contacts, lists, recipient domain providers, link clicks, etc.

> Note: Use `/statcounters` to retrieve your key performance statistics for specific campaigns, contact lists or your API Key as a whole. See the [Statistics section](https://dev.mailjet.com/guides/#key-performance-statistics) of our Email API Guide for more information.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: The resources below help you you extract details about specific delivery and engagement events - opens, clicks, email bounces, etc.

tags.name: Webhook
tags.description: The resources below helps you track email delivery and engagement events and forward the information to a webhook URL of your choice. You can use this data to create additional workflows - react to spam reports, identify bounced email addresses, sync unsubscribed contacts, etc.

tags.name: Parse API
tags.description: The Mailjet Parse API can parse the content, header and/or attachments of incoming emails and deliver it to a webhook of your choice. This makes the processing of inbound messages much easier, since all you have left to do is save the info to your CRM or database.

tags.name: Senders
tags.description: Creating and validating a sender email address or domain is necessary before you can send emails through Mailjet. The resources below help you manage your sender emails and domains. You can also retrieve the necessary information to edit your domain's SPF and DKIM records, as well as perform the necessary validations.

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: The resources below help you edit your profile or user information, as well as manage your API Keys and shared access settings.

tags.name: SMS API
tags.description: Below you will find a list of all available resources in the Mailjet API to send and manage SMS messages.
